Ingredients.2: 2 tablespoons high-heat-resistant vegetable oil, such as grapeseed oil

Ingredients.3: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.5: 4 sprigs thyme, plus more for garnish

Ingredients.6: 0.5 cup chicken broth, or more as needed

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

Directions.2: Cut off ends of russet potatoes. Stand potatoes on end, and peel them from top to bottom with a sharp knife to make each potato into a uniform cylinder. Cut each cylinder in half crosswise to make 6 potato cylinders about 2 inches long.

Directions.3: Place potatoes into a bowl of cold water for about 5 minutes to remove starch from the outsides; pat dry with paper towels.

Directions.4: Heat vegetable oil in a heavy oven-proof skillet over high heat until it shimmers slightly.

Directions.5: Place potato cylinders with the best-looking ends into the hot oil. Reduce heat to medium-high, and pan-fry potatoes until well-browned, 5 to 6 minutes. Season with salt and black pepper.

Directions.6: Flip potatoes and repeat on the other ends. As they cook, use a paper towel held with tongs to carefully blot out the oil from the skillet. Add butter and thyme sprigs to the skillet.

Directions.7: Pick up a thyme sprig with tongs and use it to paint butter over the top of the potatoes. Cook until butter foams and foam turns from white to a pale tan color. Season with more salt and pepper. Pour chicken stock into skillet.

Directions.8: Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and cook until potatoes are tender and creamy inside, about 30 minutes. If potatoes aren't tender, add 1/4 cup more stock and cook for 10 more minutes.

Directions.9: Place potatoes on a serving platter. Spoon thyme-scented butter remaining in skillet over potatoes. Garnish with thyme sprigs. Let cool about 5 minutes before serving.
